Generate a readme that gives a consolidated summary of each *.gpt file in the testdata directory.
Each entry should be a include a link to the referenced file.

tool.name: Anthropic Claude3 Model Provider
tool.description: Model provider for Anthropic hosted Claude3 models
credentials: github.com/gptscript-ai/credential as github.com/gptscript-ai/claude3-anthropic-provider/credential with "Please enter your Anthropic API Key" as message and token as field and "ANTHROPIC_API_KEY" as env
tool.instructions: #!sys.daemon /usr/bin/env python3 ${GPTSCRIPT_TOOL_DIR}/main.py

github.com/gptscript-ai/credential as gi.reference: github.com/gptscript-ai/credential as github.com/gptscript-ai/claude3-anthropic-provider/credential with "Please enter your Anthropic API Key" as message and token as field and "ANTHROPIC_API_KEY" as env

tool.name: Anthropic Claude3 Model Provider

tool.instructions: #!sys.daemon /usr/bin/env python3 ${GPTSCRIPT_TOOL_DIR}/main.py

github.com/gptscript-ai/credential as gi.reference: github.com/gptscript-ai/credential as github.com/gptscript-ai/claude3-anthropic-provider/credential with "Please enter your Anthropic API Key" as message and token as field and "ANTHROPIC_API_KEY" as env

function.name: find
function.description: Traverse a directory looking for files that match a pattern in the style of the unix find command

directory.description: The directory to search in. The current directory "." will be used as the default if no argument is passed

pattern.description: The file pattern to look for. The pattern is a traditional unix glob format with * matching any character and ? matching a single character

function.name: read
function.description: Reads the contents of a file

filename.description: The name of the file to read

function.name: summary
function.description: Summarize a gpt file

content:
tools: bob

Ask Bob "how are you doing" and repeat his reply exactly.

---
name: bob
description: I'm Bob, a friendly guy.
args: question: The question to ask Bob.

When asked how I am doing, respond with exactly "Thanks for asking "${QUESTION}", I'm doing great fellow friendly AI tool!"

function.name: read
function.description: Reads the contents of a file

filename.description: The name of the file to read

tool.name: summary
tool.instructions:
Read ${file} which is a sample GPTScript file. GPT script is an AI automation scripting language.
Briefly describe the contents of the GPTScript file and what technique the file is trying to demonstrate.

content.text:
Thank you for providing the GPTScript file. I've read its contents, and I'll briefly describe what it contains and the technique it's trying to demonstrate.

The GPTScript file "test.gpt" is demonstrating a simple AI automation script that involves interaction with a simulated AI tool or agent named "Bob". Here's a breakdown of its contents and the technique it's showcasing:

1. Content Description:
   - The script defines a tool called "bob".
   - It instructs to ask Bob a specific question: "how are you doing".
   - It then directs to repeat Bob's reply exactly.
   - The script includes a definition for the "bob" tool, describing it as a friendly character.
   - It specifies an argument "question" for interacting with Bob.
   - Finally, it provides a specific response format for when Bob is asked how he's doing.

2. Technique Demonstration:
   The script is demonstrating several key concepts in AI automation scripting:

   a) Tool Definition: It shows how to define a custom AI tool or agent (in this case, "bob") within a script.
   
   b) Parameterized Interactions: The script demonstrates how to set up parameterized interactions with an AI tool, using the "question" argument.
   
   c) Scripted Responses: It showcases how to create scripted or predefined responses for specific inputs. In this case, when asked "how are you doing", Bob has a specific, templated response.
   
   d) String Interpolation: The response uses string interpolation (${QUESTION}) to incorporate the input question into the output, demonstrating dynamic response generation.
   
   e) Exact Output Control: The script emphasizes exact repetition of responses, showing how GPTScript can be used to control AI outputs precisely.

In summary, this GPTScript file is a simple yet effective demonstration of creating a basic interactive AI tool with predefined behaviors and responses. It showcases the potential of GPTScript for crafting specific AI interactions and responses in an automation context.

content:
tools: bob

Ask Bob "how are you doing" and repeat his reply exactly.

---
name: bob
description: I'm Bob, a friendly guy.
args: question: The question to ask Bob.

#!/bin/bash

echo "Thanks for asking ${QUESTION}, I'm doing great fellow friendly AI tool!"

tool.name: summary
tool.instructions:
Read ${file} which is a sample GPTScript file. GPT script is an AI automation scripting language.
Briefly describe the contents of the GPTScript file and what technique the file is trying to demonstrate.

content.text:
I've read the contents of the file "testdata/BobAsShell/test.gpt". This is a sample GPTScript file that demonstrates a simple interaction with a custom AI tool named "Bob". Let me briefly describe the contents and the technique it's trying to demonstrate:

1. Contents of the GPTScript file:
   - The file starts by declaring the tool it will use: "bob"
   - It then provides an instruction to ask Bob "how are you doing" and repeat his reply exactly.
   - After that, there's a section that defines the "bob" tool:
     - It gives Bob a name and a description: "I'm Bob, a friendly guy."
     - It specifies that Bob takes one argument: "question"
     - The implementation of Bob is written in Bash script, which echoes a friendly response incorporating the question asked.

2. Technique demonstrated:
   This GPTScript file is demonstrating the creation and use of a custom AI tool within the GPTScript environment. Specifically, it shows:

   a. Tool Declaration: How to declare a tool that will be used in the script.
   b. Tool Definition: How to define a custom tool, including its name, description, and parameters.
   c. Tool Implementation: How to implement the tool's functionality (in this case, using a Bash script).
   d. Tool Usage: How to use the defined tool within the script by asking it a question.

The technique showcases the flexibility of GPTScript in integrating custom tools that can be implemented in various ways (like Bash scripts) and then used seamlessly within the AI conversation flow. This allows for extending the capabilities of the AI system with custom, potentially external functionalities.

In this specific example, "Bob" is a simple tool that responds to questions in a friendly manner, demonstrating how personality or specific response patterns can be incorporated into custom tools in GPTScript.

tool.name: summary
tool.instructions:
Read ${file} which is a sample GPTScript file. GPT script is an AI automation scripting language.
Briefly describe the contents of the GPTScript file and what technique the file is trying to demonstrate.

content.text:
Based on the contents of the file "testdata/SamplesReadme/test.gpt", I can provide you with a brief description of its contents and the technique it's trying to demonstrate:

The GPTScript file contains a script designed to generate a readme that provides a consolidated summary of each *.gpt file in the testdata directory. Here's a breakdown of its contents and techniques:

1. Tools used: The script utilizes three tools: sys.find, sys.read, and a custom tool called "summary".

2. Main functionality: The script is intended to create a readme with summaries of GPTScript files, including links to the referenced files.

3. Custom tool definition: The file defines a custom tool called "summary" with the following properties:
   - Name: summary
   - Description: Summarize a gpt file
   - Arguments: file (filename to summarize)
   - Tools used: sys.read

4. Summarization technique: The "summary" tool is designed to read a given GPTScript file and provide a brief description of its contents and the technique it's demonstrating.

5. AI prompt: The script includes a prompt for an AI to read the specified file, recognize it as a GPTScript file, and generate a concise description of its contents and purpose.

The main technique this file is trying to demonstrate is the creation of a custom tool within a GPTScript that can be used to summarize other GPTScript files. This approach allows for a meta-level analysis of GPTScript files, which can be useful for documentation, organization, or quick reference purposes. The script showcases how GPTScript can be used to automate the process of generating documentation for a collection of scripts.

messages.name: find

messages.content:
Thank you for providing the GPTScript file. I've read its contents, and I'll briefly describe what it contains and the technique it's trying to demonstrate.

The GPTScript file "test.gpt" is demonstrating a simple AI automation script that involves interaction with a simulated AI tool or agent named "Bob". Here's a breakdown of its contents and the technique it's showcasing:

1. Content Description:
   - The script defines a tool called "bob".
   - It instructs to ask Bob a specific question: "how are you doing".
   - It then directs to repeat Bob's reply exactly.
   - The script includes a definition for the "bob" tool, describing it as a friendly character.
   - It specifies an argument "question" for interacting with Bob.
   - Finally, it provides a specific response format for when Bob is asked how he's doing.

2. Technique Demonstration:
   The script is demonstrating several key concepts in AI automation scripting:

   a) Tool Definition: It shows how to define a custom AI tool or agent (in this case, "bob") within a script.
   
   b) Parameterized Interactions: The script demonstrates how to set up parameterized interactions with an AI tool, using the "question" argument.
   
   c) Scripted Responses: It showcases how to create scripted or predefined responses for specific inputs. In this case, when asked "how are you doing", Bob has a specific, templated response.
   
   d) String Interpolation: The response uses string interpolation (${QUESTION}) to incorporate the input question into the output, demonstrating dynamic response generation.
   
   e) Exact Output Control: The script emphasizes exact repetition of responses, showing how GPTScript can be used to control AI outputs precisely.

In summary, this GPTScript file is a simple yet effective demonstration of creating a basic interactive AI tool with predefined behaviors and responses. It showcases the potential of GPTScript for crafting specific AI interactions and responses in an automation context.
messages.name: summary

messages.content:
I've read the contents of the file "testdata/BobAsShell/test.gpt". This is a sample GPTScript file that demonstrates a simple interaction with a custom AI tool named "Bob". Let me briefly describe the contents and the technique it's trying to demonstrate:

1. Contents of the GPTScript file:
   - The file starts by declaring the tool it will use: "bob"
   - It then provides an instruction to ask Bob "how are you doing" and repeat his reply exactly.
   - After that, there's a section that defines the "bob" tool:
     - It gives Bob a name and a description: "I'm Bob, a friendly guy."
     - It specifies that Bob takes one argument: "question"
     - The implementation of Bob is written in Bash script, which echoes a friendly response incorporating the question asked.

2. Technique demonstrated:
   This GPTScript file is demonstrating the creation and use of a custom AI tool within the GPTScript environment. Specifically, it shows:

   a. Tool Declaration: How to declare a tool that will be used in the script.
   b. Tool Definition: How to define a custom tool, including its name, description, and parameters.
   c. Tool Implementation: How to implement the tool's functionality (in this case, using a Bash script).
   d. Tool Usage: How to use the defined tool within the script by asking it a question.

The technique showcases the flexibility of GPTScript in integrating custom tools that can be implemented in various ways (like Bash scripts) and then used seamlessly within the AI conversation flow. This allows for extending the capabilities of the AI system with custom, potentially external functionalities.

In this specific example, "Bob" is a simple tool that responds to questions in a friendly manner, demonstrating how personality or specific response patterns can be incorporated into custom tools in GPTScript.

function.name: find
function.description: Traverse a directory looking for files that match a pattern in the style of the unix find command

directory.description: The directory to search in. The current directory "." will be used as the default if no argument is passed

pattern.description: The file pattern to look for. The pattern is a traditional unix glob format with * matching any character and ? matching a single character

function.name: read
function.description: Reads the contents of a file

filename.description: The name of the file to read

function.name: summary
function.description: Summarize a gpt file

tool.instructions:
Generate a readme that gives a consolidated summary of each *.gpt file in the testdata directory.
Each entry should be a include a link to the referenced file.

content.text:
Based on the summaries of the GPTScript files found in the testdata directory, I'll now generate a README with consolidated summaries for each file, including links to the referenced files:

# GPTScript Files Summary

## [testdata/Bob/test.gpt](testdata/Bob/test.gpt)

This GPTScript file demonstrates a simple AI automation script involving interaction with a simulated AI tool or agent named "Bob". Key features include:

- Definition of a custom AI tool called "bob"
- Demonstration of parameterized interactions with the AI tool
- Showcase of scripted responses for specific inputs
- Use of string interpolation for dynamic response generation
- Emphasis on exact output control

The script effectively demonstrates the creation of a basic interactive AI tool with predefined behaviors and responses, highlighting the potential of GPTScript for crafting specific AI interactions in an automation context.

## [testdata/BobAsShell/test.gpt](testdata/BobAsShell/test.gpt)

This GPTScript file showcases the creation and use of a custom AI tool named "Bob" within the GPTScript environment. Notable aspects include:

- Declaration and definition of a custom tool
- Implementation of the tool's functionality using a Bash script
- Demonstration of tool usage within the script
- Integration of personality into the custom tool's responses

The script illustrates the flexibility of GPTScript in integrating custom tools that can be implemented in various ways (like Bash scripts) and then used seamlessly within the AI conversation flow. This allows for extending the capabilities of the AI system with custom, potentially external functionalities.

## [testdata/SamplesReadme/test.gpt](testdata/SamplesReadme/test.gpt)

This GPTScript file contains a script designed to generate a readme that provides a consolidated summary of each *.gpt file in the testdata directory. Key features include:

- Utilization of multiple tools: sys.find, sys.read, and a custom "summary" tool
- Definition of a custom "summary" tool for summarizing GPTScript files
- Implementation of a meta-level analysis of GPTScript files
- Automation of documentation generation for a collection of scripts

The script demonstrates how GPTScript can be used to create custom tools for analyzing and documenting other GPTScript files, showcasing its potential for automating meta-level tasks and generating documentation.

This README provides an overview of the GPTScript files found in the testdata directory, highlighting their key features and demonstrating various techniques for working with GPTScript.
